Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2013 09:41AM MYL wrote: mgdsmc, thank you for bringing up this issue on starting treatment overseas. I don't want to wait for a month or more to start the treatment. If I have to, I will do 3 cycles here, that's what my doctor recommended after which they will check the response.
Posts.Title: Neoadjuvant chemo FEC100 protocol MYL MYL

Posts.Content: MYL wrote: Hi! I've been very nervous about my upcoming mastectomy. I'm not worried about the procedure but the anesthesia part, having never been put under before. And today BS told me that on top of the general anesthesia, I would also be given nerve block. Anyone had mastectomy with nerve block? I was told that it would really help with the post surgery pain and they can also use less dosage on the general anethesia part. But I can decline it if I choose so. Dx 1/12/2013, IDC, 3cm, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nerve block for mastectomy MYL SpecialK

Posts.Content: MYL wrote: I just got diagnosed abroad. SInce the tumor is large and it is grade3, I perfer to start on pre-operative chemo. The doctor here said that their standard pre-operative is FEC100. from the infromation she provided, it consists of : Granisetron+Dexamethasone+Esomeprazole  Epirubicin Cyclophosphamide 5-Fluorouracil. She said that this is the international standard so I want to just get one cycle here, I can continue with the same thing after going home. One concern she had was that I'm ER+/PR+/HER- an KI-67 is 15%. she said that this profile does not respond the best to pre-operative chemo. Any input/suggestions appreciated. I really do want to start ASAP, the positive LN worries me. Thanks so much! Dx 1/12/2013, IDC, 3cm, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Neoadjuvant chemo FEC100 protocol MYL MYL

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2013 09:15AM MYL wrote: Hi Rozem, my tumor was 3.7x2.2 on ultrasound. I perfer to get the chemo because of the tumor size and my small breast. I'm not sure why I only got Ki-67 of 15%, the tumor just came out of no where and yes it is grade3 based on microscopic.
Posts.Title: Neoadjuvant chemo FEC100 protocol MYL MYL

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2013 10:58AM MYL wrote: Thanks a lot ladies! I learned a lot from the discussion
Posts.Title: Neoadjuvant chemo FEC100 protocol MYL MYL

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2013 06:31AM - edited Sep 14, 2013 06:32AM by MYL Thanks for the replies. It does look like nerve block is used quite often these days. Sarah- sorry to hear that you are still having trouble due to the pain. Do you think the expander is the more of a culprit than the mastectomy incisions? I wish you get good relieve soon and get some quality sleep. Your body can't heal without adequate sleep. And thank you for the advices on pain management. Sandymom- it's strange the block haws not taken. I'm glad all went well nevertheless. I'm worried about the opposite. That the block would cause some permanent side effect after the surgery. Specials- that was a lot of manipulation in one surgery and I'm glad you managed well afterwards. I finally decided not to have nip/skin saved and no immediate reconstruction with expander. I hope this will make everything a lot easier.
Posts.Title: Nerve block for mastectomy MYL SpecialK
